Key Match Events: Lonzo Ball made his long-awaited return in Chicago's 125-123 preseason win over the Minnesota Timberwolves on Wednesday, playing 15 minutes and finishing with 10 points and one rebound, assist, steal and block apiece.
Pre-Game Insights: Head coach Billy Donovan pointed to how a lot of variables are still at play when it comes to Ball's usage and availability even with him back healthy.
Post-Match Reflections: Lonzo Ball expressed confidence in his ability to return to occupying a meaningful role for the team after persistent knee trouble kept him out for two-plus NBA seasons.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ball's last appearance in the regular season was in January 2022. Since then, he has undergone three separate surgeries on his left knee, which collectively raised concerns over his future as a player.
Others: Ball's return was a massive step in his comeback but far from the final point in his process to become a dynamic two-way presence again.
